panels.description: Number of active brokers. We should always have at least 3 brokers.
panels.title: Broker Count

panels.description: There must be always only one controller otherwise we have split brain.
panels.title: Who is controller now?

panels.description: Total topic count as seen by controller.. in case of split brain this value will probably be double of what it should be.
panels.title: Topic count in cluster

panels.description: This indicator provides only a cluster controller, and it shows the number of cluster partitions that currently have no master replica.
panels.title: Offline partitions

panels.description: The Under Replicated Partitions metric displays the number of partitions that do not have enough replicas to meet the desired replication factor. A partition will also be considered under-replicated if the correct number of replicas exist, but one or more of the replicas have fallen significantly behind the partition leader. The two most common causes of under-replicated partitions are that one or more brokers is unresponsive, or the cluster is experiencing performance issues and one or more brokers have fallen behind.
panels.title: Under-Replicated Partitions

panels.description: Total partitions reported by each brokers counted together.
panels.title: Total partitions reported by brokers

panels.description: Keep in mind, that consumer_offsets has 50 partitions.
panels.title: Partitions per broker

panels.description: Keep in mind, that consumer_offsets has 50 partitions.
panels.title: How many partitions does the broker lead

panels.description:
Primary partitions who don't match replication factor. It indicates one or more brokers might be down and new replica wasn't setup yet.

https://sematext.com/blog/kafka-metrics-to-monitor/

The Under Replicated Partitions metric displays the number of partitions that do not have enough replicas to meet the desired replication factor. A partition will also be considered under-replicated if the correct number of replicas exist, but one or more of the replicas have fallen significantly behind the partition leader. The two most common causes of under-replicated partitions are that one or more brokers is unresponsive, or the cluster is experiencing performance issues and one or more brokers have fallen behind.
panels.title: UnderReplicatedPartitions

panels.description:
Number of partitions without an active leader, therefore not readable nor writeable.

https://sematext.com/blog/kafka-metrics-to-monitor/
panels.title: OfflinePartitionsCount
